main event: A bright white object was sighted in Toulab, France on July 11, 1955, which was observed for 3 minutes by radar.
interesting points: The object was descending initially, then continued upwards without making any noise.
The object stopped and hovered, suspended in midair, and then started rotating and floating like a pendulum.

When the object appeared stationary, the path of the object and the observers were approximately parallel, and the object then decreased in size as it streaked off and went out of view in about 10 minutes.
The report concludes that the object was possibly a guided missile, a balloon, or an aircraft, but the evaluation was unknown.
The case was filed under ATIC #248736 and TR 86-55-02.
photographs: no photographs present in the report
